meanings.definition: Showing or characterized by excessive submission or obedience
meanings.sent1: Her slavishness devotion to her boss was evident in how she never questioned his decisions.
meanings.sent2: The dog's slavishness loyalty to its owner was heartwarming.
meanings.sent3: The robot's slavishness obedience to every command made it the perfect assistant.
meanings.sent4: The politician's slavishness adherence to party policies cost him his independent voice.
meanings.sent5: The student's slavishness copying of his friend's homework was quickly noticed by the teacher.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being servile or submissive
meanings.sent1: The king demanded slavishness from his subjects, expecting unwavering loyalty.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, slavishness is seen as a sign of respect towards authority figures.
meanings.sent3: The slavishness of the butler towards his employer sometimes bordered on comical.
meanings.sent4: The slavishness of the fans towards the celebrity was almost like a form of worship.
meanings.sent5: The slavishness of the employee towards the demanding boss was palpable in the office.
